section.name: FOOD HABITS IN PHIL COMM: Food Habits in Philadelphia Communities

comments: Through partnership with a local public school 6th grade class, this course examines food culture in West Philadelphia via discussions, interviews, journaling, and research. It explores diversity in low-income neighborhoods and how food accessibility affects eating behavior. This class is an ABCS class. The course was divided between Thursdays spent working with the 6th grade students at the ABCS site and Tuesdays spent on Penn’s campus planning for Thursdays with the students and holding class discussions.   Students were required to complete various types of assignments, including reading articles, writing blog posts, uploading to the elementary school’s website, completing two journal posts each week, and writing a final research paper.
